intro: Sedum wallichianum, commonly known as the Himalayan stonecrop, is a succulent plant native to the Himalayas. It is characterized by its fleshy, blue-green leaves that are arranged in a rosette pattern. The plant produces small, star-shaped yellow flowers during the summer months. It thrives in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to high-altitude environments. Sedum wallichianum is often used in rock gardens and as a drought-tolerant ornamental plant.
